message: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes you a Happy and Prosperous Diwali. May millions of diyas illuminate your life with endless joy, health, hopes, and dreams forever.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur conducted yet another edition of the Kolkata Robotics workshop at Vidyamandir Auditorium on 4th November.

We are very thankful to Ms Moon Moon Sen who graced the Workshop with her presence and interacted with the students, encouraging them towards technology. 

This festive season for the students of Kolkata has begun with an opportunity to dive into the sea of Robotics and technology in the most ingenious way. With many more opportunities to come in the 16th edition of Kshitij, we would like to thank Kolkata for the overwhelming response and the full house auditorium. 

#Kolkata_Workshop
#KTJ2k19

The wait is over!!
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is back with the 3rd edition of its regional Kascade, which will be conducted in the major cities across India in mid-October.
Prelims of the flagship events Nightshift, Math-Olympiad, Source Code, and Anadigix will be conducted. Teams that will be shortlisted in the prelims will be guaranteed a direct entry in the final round to be held at IIT Kharagpur during Kshitij in 18th-20th January 2019. Start preparing and beat the competition.
#Kascade
#KTJ2k19

Design Credits: Goutham Pati

message:
Walking freely on the streets, we experience a sense of freedom, a wave of happiness around us. The reason behind these millions of smiles is none other than this eminent personality. Born on 2nd of October and later came to be known as the Father of the Nation - Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, lovingly addressed as BAPU. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes you all a Happy Gandhi Jayanti.
#150thAnniversaryofGandhiJayanti
#KTJ2k19

A dad is someone who wants to catch you before you fall, but instead picks you up, brushes you off, and lets you try again. A dad is someone who wants to keep you from making mistakes but instead lets you find your own way, even though his heart breaks in silence when you get hurt. A dad is not a hero. He is a silent guardian, a watchful protector, he is a dark knight. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes a very happy father's day to all the superdads.
#Happy_Fathers_Day

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur reveals its exhibition line up for the 15th edition. 
First in line is the robotic band from Japan which will fuse together,  music and Technology. 

Next up is Team Synergy,  a lunar robot from Croatia and one of the top teams of the Google Lunar XPrize. 

The third exhibition is Indro 3.0,  the tallest humanoid robot of India. 

And last but not the least is a 3D mapping drone from India.

For all the Bollywood cinephiles present out there, the time has come!
Few filmmakers carry a signature style that separates their work from others, and Imtiaz Ali is one of them. Be there at TOAT on 21st January to learn the other sides of his story, the unspoken lines, and the unwritten verse.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Asteria Aerospace Pvt. Ltd. presents a tech-talk on the topic 'Autopilot for Unmanned Aerial Systems'.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is capable of adapting itself to the rough terrain it is sent into. You are asked to design the prototype of such a bot that is capable of changing the distance between its wheels so as to cover a ground that cannot be done otherwise. There are multiple valleys that converge, diverge or are in an arc form and are to be crossed. 
Your challenge is to design a bot robust enough to adapt itself according to the valleys it faces. There are also certain parts of the path that you need to complete before you can cover the further ground. Use a mechanical gripper to complete this problem statement.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to: www.robotix.in/event/poles-apart/
